critique: This document is an executive order from Franklin D. Roosevelt approving an agreement related to the National Industrial Recovery Act. It pertains to fair competition within the construction industry in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania. The document itself doesn't directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It primarily focuses on economic regulation and the role of the federal government in overseeing industry agreements. The ideological tilt is moderately liberal due to the interventionist nature of the National Industrial Recovery Act. The executive power is expanded as the President is approving the agreement based on the authority vested in him by the Act. Federalism is strengthened as the federal government is overseeing an agreement within a state.
